description.plain: DeBarge was an American musical recording group composed of several members of the DeBarge family. In addition to various solo projects completed by members of the family, DeBarge was active between 1979 to 1989. The group originally consisted of Mark, Randy, and El. Bunny, James, and Bobby joined later.

songs.full_title: A Dream by DeBarge
songs.title: A Dream

description.plain:
The sample used in “I Ain’t Mad At Cha” by 2Pac may be what most recognize about this song today, but it’s a unique song in its own right.

As one of the only DeBarge songs where Bunny takes lead vocals, it’s presumably from a woman’s point of view. Further, it’s one of the more tragic songs in the DeBarge catalogue as the narrator’s hope of reuniting with a former partner is granted each night in a recurring dream. However, each morning she’s jolted into reality only to once again realize that she’s alone in the world and has no one to love or love her. The tragedy is that she may be able to move on to another relationship, but each night the dream retards her progress.

songs.full_title: Who’s Holding Donna Now by DeBarge
songs.title: Who’s Holding Donna Now

description.plain:
Who’s Holding Donna Now was a single released from DeBarge’s album Rhythm of the Night.

The song peaked at #6 on the Billboard Hot 100, #2 on Billboard’s R&B Singles chart and topped Billboard’s Adult Contemporary chart for three weeks in 1985.
